abstracts.cdata!:
The Yonki Hydroelectric Project will
            comprise: (i) construction of a 60 m high earth-fill dam on
            the Ramu River with a total embankment volume of about 1.8
            million cubic meters, a spillway system and outlet
            structure, and associated works; (ii) installation of two
            additional 15 MW generating units together with step-up
            transformers at the existing Ramu I power station; (iii)
            relocation of a part of the Highlands highway and local
            access roads, together totalling 22km; (iv) engineering and
            consulting services; (v) a training program; (vi) technical
            assistance for institutional support; and (vii) a rural
            electrification component.
